back_cards.definition_en: The way in which something is done or happens
back_cards.example_en: She spoke in a confident manner during the presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: A person's outward behavior or demeanor
back_cards.example_en: His polite manner impressed everyone at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A style or method of doing something
back_cards.example_en: The chef prepared the dish in the traditional manner.

back_cards.definition_en: Customs or habits of a group
back_cards.example_en: Learning the local manner of greeting was important for the traveler.
What manner of creature could survive in such a harsh environment?

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling or showing sudden wonder or disbelief
back_cards.example_en: She was surprised by the unexpected gift.

back_cards.definition_en: Caught off guard by an event
back_cards.example_en: The team was surprised by the sudden change in strategy.
He was surprised to see snow in the desert.
I was surprised that she finished the marathon.
They were surprised to hear about the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: A rate or proportion per hundred
back_cards.example_en: A high percentage of students passed the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: A portion of a whole expressed as a number
back_cards.example_en: The company donated a percentage of its profits to charity.

back_cards.definition_en: A share or part of something
back_cards.example_en: What percentage of the budget is allocated to marketing?
The percentage of voters increased this year.
The discount was a percentage off the original price.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or amount
back_cards.example_en: The massive building dominated the city skyline.
The discovery was a massive breakthrough in science.
The storm caused massive damage to the coastal town.
The festival attracted a massive crowd from across the country.
She took on a massive project to redesign the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A visible mass of water droplets in the sky
back_cards.example_en: The cloud blocked the sun, casting a shadow over the field.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of data stored online
back_cards.example_en: She saved her photos to the cloud for easy access.
A cloud of dust rose from the construction site.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of particles or objects
back_cards.example_en: A cloud of insects swarmed around the light.
There’s a cloud of doubt hanging over the decision.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who achieves victory in a competition
back_cards.example_en: The winner of the race received a gold medal.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who succeeds in an endeavor
back_cards.example_en: She felt like a winner after completing her first novel.

back_cards.definition_en: A product or idea that gains widespread success
back_cards.example_en: The new phone model was a winner in the market.

back_cards.definition_en: A person admired for their achievements
back_cards.example_en: He’s a winner in the eyes of his community.

back_cards.definition_en: The top performer in an event
back_cards.example_en: The winner of the debate was decided by audience votes.
She gave an honest answer to the difficult question.
He’s an honest businessman who values trust.
Her honest smile made everyone feel welcome.
It was an honest mistake, and he apologized immediately.
I’ll be honest, I didn’t expect the project to succeed.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest a plan or idea
back_cards.example_en: She proposed a new strategy to increase sales.
He proposed to his partner during a sunset walk.
The committee proposed changes to the school policy.

back_cards.definition_en: To nominate someone for a role
back_cards.example_en: They proposed her as the new team leader.
I propose to finish the report by tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To depend on someone or something
back_cards.example_en: She relies on her team to meet deadlines.
We rely on the bus to get to work on time.
He relies on his family during tough times.
The study relies on data from recent surveys.
They rely on their mentor for career advice.
The meal comes with soup plus a side salad.

back_cards.definition_en: Added to a number or amount
back_cards.example_en: Two plus two equals four.
The package includes free shipping plus a discount.
She brought her laptop plus some notebooks to the meeting.
The job offers good pay plus flexible hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of words expressing a complete thought
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a clear sentence to explain her idea.

back_cards.definition_en: A punishment given by a court
back_cards.example_en: The judge issued a five-year sentence for the crime.
The essay contained several complex sentences.
His sentence about the project’s failure surprised everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A linguistic unit in language learning
back_cards.example_en: The textbook taught how to form a proper sentence.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of asking for something
back_cards.example_en: She made a request for more time to finish the task.
The request for funding was submitted to the board.

back_cards.definition_en: A message sent to obtain something
back_cards.example_en: His request for information was answered quickly.
At the guest’s request, the chef prepared a vegan dish.
The server processed the user’s request for data.
Her appearance at the event was elegant and striking.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of showing up or becoming visible
back_cards.example_en: The moon’s appearance in the sky was breathtaking.
He maintained an appearance of calm despite the stress.

back_cards.definition_en: The external look of an object
back_cards.example_en: The car’s appearance was sleek and modern.
The band’s appearance on TV boosted their fame.
She sent an email regarding the new project timeline.
He had questions regarding the company’s policies.
The discussion regarding safety measures lasted hours.
The report regarding climate change was alarming.
I have no complaints regarding the service.
The restaurant served excellent food.
Her excellent performance earned her a promotion.
The view from the mountain was excellent.
He’s an excellent guitarist who captivates audiences.
The team delivered an excellent presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who has committed a crime
back_cards.example_en: The police arrested the criminal after the robbery.
The criminal was sentenced to community service.
The detective tracked down a notorious criminal.

back_cards.definition_en: A person involved in organized crime
back_cards.example_en: The criminal led a gang in the city.
The environmental criminal was fined heavily.

back_cards.definition_en: A mineral used to season food
back_cards.example_en: She added a pinch of salt to the soup.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance used in chemical processes
back_cards.example_en: The lab stored salt for experiments.
The recipe called for sea salt.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for value or wisdom
back_cards.example_en: He’s the salt of the earth, always helping others.
Roads were treated with salt to melt ice.

back_cards.definition_en: The quality of being physically attractive
back_cards.example_en: The beauty of the sunset took her breath away.
The painting captured the beauty of the landscape.
Her kindness was a beauty that shone through.
The beauty of the music moved the audience.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing that is beautiful
back_cards.example_en: The garden was a beauty to behold.
She filled the bottle with water before hiking.
He opened a bottle of wine for dinner.
The recipe required a bottle of olive oil.

back_cards.definition_en: A container for cosmetics or medicine
back_cards.example_en: The bottle of lotion was nearly empty.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for courage or emotion
back_cards.example_en: She kept her feelings in a bottle for years.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a larger system
back_cards.example_en: The engine is a key component of the car.
She replaced a faulty component in the computer.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of a complex whole
back_cards.example_en: Teamwork was a vital component of their success.
Sugar is a component of the cake batter.
The app’s component handled user authentication.
The lawyer charged a high fee for her advice.

back_cards.definition_en: A cost for membership or access
back_cards.example_en: The gym’s monthly fee was affordable.
The bank added a fee for the withdrawal.
Late returns incur a fee at the library.
The consultant’s fee was included in the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the Jewish people or their culture
back_cards.example_en: The Jewish festival of Hanukkah is celebrated with lights.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to Judaism as a religion
back_cards.example_en: She attended a Jewish synagogue for the holidays.
The family enjoyed a Jewish wedding ceremony.
The museum displayed Jewish artifacts from ancient times.
His Jewish heritage influenced his writing.
Is this book yours or mine?
The decision is yours to make.
Yours sincerely, John Smith.
The keys on the table are yours.
The choice of color is entirely yours.
The clothes were dry after being in the sun.
The desert is a dry and harsh environment.
His dry humor made the meeting more bearable.
She preferred dry wine over sweet varieties.
The lecture was so dry that many students left early.
